Reviews.Title: Still works great
Reviews.Author: Confidential Name
Reviews.Content: Normally I don't have kind things to say about any Chinese made item. This one still surprises me after a couple of months. Not only was it far cheaper ($20 in lieu of $500) of other models I've purchased, but it still actually works with daily use. Nearly every other Chinese product I've purchases has failed within a week or two. This one has an added feature I really like, a simple rheostat on the side to adjust the sensitivity of wireless signal detection, plus LED and signal strength meter. My $500 model from Brickhouse Security was always giving false alerts on stray signals I couldn't filter out, and I never knew the distance or direction the signal was coming from (this one has a compass on it as well. Tiny, but useful when chasing hidden signals).It has other features the high dollar model doesn't. In addition to earphones, it can be set to vibrate. This is excellent when you are scanning hotels, cars in public view, or other things you don't need nosy people asking about while you are helping your customers or law enforcement. Another benefit over my overpriced unit, the red LED's used to detect camera lenses (that aren't wireless), the flash speed can be adjusted also. This is better for time lapsed cameras that open and close the lenses openings (like critter cameras, motion photo cameras, etc.).Using this cheap model (that also comes with rechargeable batteries and AC adapter)has helped me spend less time chasing down false alerts on things that aren't there. Just in recent weeks, I've located one GPS tracker on a car and several "Voyeur" cameras set up with client's vehicles or private areas (locker rooms, bathrooms, showers) in less time than usual. It is also much smaller than my commercial unit, thus making it easy to carry in a shirt or pants pocket unnoticed.

Reviews.Title: Missing Pieces
Reviews.Author: Quixotic
Reviews.Content: Let me be clear that the retailer I dealt with was very polite and prompt in dealing with the problems I had with this device, but my suspicion is that it is a serious manufacturing problem with the AGPtek bug detector that caused the difficulties.My device arrived without the little bit of glass that should be in the window. If you look at the device as it is pictured there is a red circle at the top by the antenna, on the back are a set of LEDs placed around the window. The idea is you activate the LEDS and then walk into a room, look through the little red piece of glass while the LEDS are flashing. If there is a spy camera set up somewhere, you'll be able to see the recording light as a particularly large, bright red object. Since mine was completely missing the glass there was no way to use this as a surveillance camera detector.The radio signal detector is supposed to work by turning the dial from 'off' to either auditory detect or vibrate detect. You scan by using the scrolling button on the right side to increase the range of waves you are monitoring and the little LEDS on the FRONT of the device should turn red as you scan. If you detect something the device should either vibrate differently or let off a different sound. Mine got stuck. It would get stuck in between LED settings and noise settings. I've tested it using a cell phone, a recording device, and in an open space away from any possible bugging equipment. It makes exactly the same sounds at all times, and the LEDS do not function properly.Now I think I just received a faulty item, but I'm not sure. I've since taken care of my scanning needs in another way. If you receive a device without glass and without changing settings, you have a broken item. If you receive a device that works, the instructions will make you giggle. They are oddest translation of the original Chinese imaginable. I strongly suggest watching one of the Youtube instructional videos on how to use the AGPtek. It'll explain everything you need.Again, if this thing had worked, it would have been perfect, but I don't know if I received the only broken device, or if this is a shoddy line of product. Buyer be conscious.

Reviews.Title: bugged
Reviews.Author: David Howard
Reviews.Content: if you think your bugged this is a great device it does what it says it does also picks up signals that you didn't know that is there recommend this product for anyone that may be under someones hidden camera or wireless camera it will find the camera amazon had this shipped promptly to my house in little time, thanks amazon

Reviews.Title: Interesting but in a good way
Reviews.Author: ImBatMan
Reviews.Content: There are some security and spy shops that have similar products and you can learn how to use them properly from someone like CCTV Girl - see YouTube.The device works but because so many things use the 1 GHz range and 2 GHz is it sometimes hard to figure out whether its a real spy device or not.  Amazingly I've actually found many things that set off this device.  I did find hidden cameras from the reflective RED LEDs using the scope.  The lenses of the hidden camera reflects the light.  Somehow the scope helps see that.  Go figure.The vibrating mode to find hidden wall devices works as well.  Kind of like a metal detector.  You hold it to a wall and swipe back and forth the vibrating is steady until a signal is detected where your device will begin signalling you with a stronger vibration and light meter all lit up.Kind of creepy too because a few times when ghosts were being announced as being present the meter shot up and beeped like crazy.  Of course we took it like some rogue signal pass by.  We couldn't get that same signal later, in the same area.Cool device to have though.

Reviews.Title: Great product to detect bugs
Reviews.Author: Roy Muranaka
Reviews.Content: Detects audio and video bugs very good and easy to use with clear instructions. I would reccemend this for anyone

Reviews.Title: A fun toy that works
Reviews.Author: awesomesexy
Reviews.Content: I had wanted something that detected rf signals for fun to play around with.  I did not want to spend several hundred dollars on a detector.  This was exactly what I was looking for.  It's inexpensive, works, and is fun to play with.First, camera detection.  It shows cameras that are pointing at the detector as a bright pinpoint of light.  It worked on my cell phone, webcam, and 3ds cameras which were all pinhole types.  I did not have any other kinds to test on it.  One thing to note, it's viewable from across a room but it's not an incredibly bright light.  You may not notice it if you're looking for a hidden camera and it's surrounded by reflective surfaces. This was an extra feature I wasn't looking for in an rf detector but I love it.  Just this function itself could have sold it for me.For rf detection it works.  I've tested it on remote controls for remote control cars,  wireless video game controllers, my remote car lock/unlock thing, my cell phone, and my wireless router and it can detect them all. It's detection range is short though, about a foot.  This may be due to background noise or that just might be the range of the detector.  It only detects signals being sent, so it won't detect a phone until it tries to make a call.  It won't detect things like television remotes since they use ir instead of rf.  For the price I'm loving it.The instructions are in broken English.  You will only get a vague idea of what to do with it.  I did not see that as an issue since it's fairly simple and strait forward and I do not normally read instructions.  I did read this however since several other posts had mentioned it. You got a power switch that can select between mute/vibrate and unmute/tone.  A button for the forward LED's for the camera detector.  Push the button and you can see the LEDs light up and you look through the glass lens part.  And finally a sensitivity adjustment on the side.  If it were more complicated then a lack of clear instructions would be a huge issue, but as it is I had no problems.The compass is a cheap addition.  It really would have been better with no compass at all.  It does not align itself north.  When you go into a camping section and look at an array of compasses and there's the fifty cent ones in a bin at the end where you assume several are only pointing north because some have to point that way out of pure chance that would be the compass this has.  I do have to say to it's credit it does point to magnets that are close, but relying on it in the woods would be asking to get lost.For one last note, on the LED button it is labeled laser.  I'm going to chalk this one up to poor translation.Would I use this if I ever thought someone put hidden cameras or other things in my house?  It would work, though for something like that I'd actually fork out the money for a higher quality detector.Overall I love this.  It works.  It has an extra part that also works and is a joy to mess with.  The issues are minor enough that I can overlook them for the price.  Especially in comparison to other items that cost hundreds.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Colleen Coffman
Reviews.Content: Found the hidden camera at my job  instantly!  GoIt's good to know who is watching you.  Will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Worthless junk, repackaged by Amazon.
Reviews.Author: technoid
Reviews.Content: This product was USED! Amazon just repackaged an item that had been returned many times; if I have to pay the price of a NEW item, I expect to receive a NEW item! With that said, the product is flawed...it has an adjustment dial (potentiometer) on the side that allows the user to adjust the amount of beeps for as many or as few times as desired, therefore it is impossible to get an accurate reading. Maybe that's why so many people had returned it. I am very disgusted with Amazon for this trickery.

Reviews.Title: Detector
Reviews.Author: frank "fzza"
Reviews.Content: This thing is sensitive! It picks up a lot of things if u use it right. It even picks up my wireless mouse movements.

Reviews.Title: TOY
Reviews.Author: CurbsideLife "CurbsideLife"
Reviews.Content: Should be in the toy section. It did not work at all for me. Judging by the reviews it doesn't work for barely anyone.

Reviews.Title: I should have known.
Reviews.Author: P. Price
Reviews.Content: This thing is garbage. I saw the bad reviews, but the optimist in me wanted to give it a try anyway. The optimist in me is an idiot. That is all.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but works.
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: Its a bit cheap but it does detect my phones signals, I would bet my life on it but it is kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: Needs lots of improvment.
Reviews.Author: Smith "SLI"
Reviews.Content: Headphone jack is 2.5mm instead of the 3.5mm that everything else uses which makes it a pain to use headphones. I bought a 2.5 to 3.5 adaptor and now it doesn't get any sound. And the earbuds that they send you are the kind that you wouldn't pay a 5 cents for.

Reviews.Title: Instructions are horrible..
Reviews.Author: Cameron Scott French
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. It is difficult to decode the instructions, as they seem to have been translated from an unknown language into chinese, then into English. I was able to find instructions on youtube (different model, but same general instructions) from CCTVGIRL.It seems more like a novelty than an actual useable device.

Reviews.Title: It did not work as claimed...
Reviews.Author: Viet L.
Reviews.Content: It did not work as claimed...The sensor did not detect anything...The instruction sheet was incomplete and not clear...Don't know what it is good for since the objective claim is false.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Larry E. Jones
Reviews.Content: Came with Chinese power adaptor so it cant be charged to a standard US power receptacle. A plug adapter from Radio Shack costs more than the unit, complete junk. The rave reviews for this are probably posted by the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: W. T. peace "perrinnn"
Reviews.Content: This detector picks up call waves, radio waves, and most other frequencies. Also hidden cameras. It is a little bit of an art but easy to learn.  I am sure the NSA uses something this device can't pick up but for most cases it is tested by me and given a two thumbs up. I have made a few bucks already sweeping for hidden devices.

Reviews.Title: Requires some tweaking to get it to work the way you need it.
Reviews.Author: LL
Reviews.Content: It does pick up wireless signals. Keep in mind that WIFI and Wireless routers will set this off. It would be nice to have switch  for selecting frequencies

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Hatiqe Egriu
Reviews.Content: I hate it! Worst product ever. It didn't work when I got it. Instructions were the worst. DOn't buy it.

Reviews.Title: this thing comes in handy,
Reviews.Author: lisa morrison
Reviews.Content: this little setup works great, I found 2 field cameras at work plus a lot of other cool stuff thanks

Reviews.Title: DON'T !!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Brest "111"
Reviews.Content: Don't Buy This Junk!!!!!!!!!!!!. Ask Amazon....I am a volume buyer and am VERY thankful for Amazon. The convenience to literally buy ANYTHING from home....If you Don't have prime ....and don't realize the savings that entails....I beg you to investigate.Now ....first negative PRODUCT review because it is pathetic. Arrived shaken loose. spent an hour reassembling. (hate sending stuff back) Worked long enough to know ...that it never was supposed to work.JUNK!!!!!!Sending back....(and I NEVER hardly ever send anything back or complain....I must on this however....SPEND A FEW MORE BUCKS....That's my advice.......No Lense EITHER!!!

Reviews.Title: What Bug?
Reviews.Author: wendy barreau
Reviews.Content: This "device" doesn't work and if someone really needs something to find a bug or tracker, go look else where. What a waste of time and most importantly money!

Reviews.Title: It really will find those hidden spy bugs and cameras
Reviews.Author: Bruce "Bruce"
Reviews.Content: This is not magic like on Maxwell Smart.  While standing in the middle of the room, you adjust the sensitivity so the it barely does not beep. Then move around the room.  It will beep when near any operating RF transmitter.  It will detect your home WiFi, cell phone, cordless house phone, and car remote, but only when they are transmitting.  It will not tell you what is transmitting, just that something is transmitting. As you get closer to the transmitter the beeping becomes louder and more LEDs light up.  Think of this as a portable radio that receives all stations at the same time.  This will not detect your neighbor's WiFi.  You need to be within a few feet of the transmitter to pick up a signal.  This is nothing fancy, just inexpensive and basic.  It comes with a rechargeable battery and charger.  I have paid this much for a charger alone.  Such a deal.

Reviews.Title: Instructions Usless
Reviews.Author: michael fox
Reviews.Content: Directions are in broken english; incomplete; don't make sense. A kid could write  better instructions! It would be nice to know how to operate this. So far don't even know if it works or how to use it

Reviews.Title: doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Haroun Walton
Reviews.Content: The piece of crap beeps and buzzes and flashes red lights and that's it...doesn't detect anything. One is too high a rating

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: chewi "chewidude"
Reviews.Content: Doesn't always work! It's a toy.Amazon requires four teen more words so I am just going to keep typing

Reviews.Title: Simple tool, senses only in short distances
Reviews.Author: C. Jang "novice"
Reviews.Content: Can detect cell phone, wireless router, cordless phone signals, but only detectable when it is very near (10 ~ 30 cm).

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: D. JONES "Spencercounty"
Reviews.Content: This thing just makes noise when it wants to. You can not find and hidder electronics with this at all.

Reviews.Title: seems sorta cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Christie Clark
Reviews.Content: The directions are impossiable to read. Had to get a magnifing glass. It goes off everywhere as if there is a "bug" everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: I do not understand
Reviews.Author: Rodrigues J.
Reviews.Content: Poor instructions. Was not able to make it work as described. I do not know of this is due to the poor instructions or that the product is bad....

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Niki Gaiter
Reviews.Content: Worked exactly as it should. Needed it to know if I should have someone professional. If you're having issues using it, try watching the YouTube videos, they're more helpful than the manual.

Reviews.Title: It's a Toy
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: It's not like what the description says. This is just a toy, nothing more. The only time it worked was when I put it by my cell phone or my house phone. Out of curiosity, I walked around my backyard, and it started making beeping noises by a tree. I checked the tree out, and it had nothing.This toy is not accurate, and it does a very poor job. It's also cheap plastic and just overall, not the best item to purchase. I had to return it and received a full refund.

Reviews.Title: DOES ABSOLUTELY NOTHING
Reviews.Author: Don W
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to use this in hotel rooms and rental properties to make sure I wasn't being recorded, but this thing does nothing. I pointed the "laser" light (flashing red LEDs) directly at my phone while it was recording me and got nothing back - no highlighted camera lens, nothing but a nice rosey view of what appears to be an idle camera phone. Same with any angle I tried, same with front camera on the phone, same with iPad cameras. RF detector goes off everywhere because, guess what?, there's RF everywhere. I was really hoping the strobe would work to detect camera lenses, but it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Worth It
Reviews.Author: L.A.
Reviews.Content: This little device looks like a toy, is lightweight and small, but functions well for detecting suspicious frequencies.  It comes in a little box with a magnetized lid for safekeeping.  It picks up regular electronics, hot wires in the home, and although I haven't found any surreptitious surveillance devices (yet), it would likely do the job as well as any other higher-cost detection device with lights, a sensitivity dial, and a noisemaker.  One drawback is the headphone jack is rather small, not standard; even though it comes with headphones that fit and work, I wanted to use my own headphones and had to get an adapter.  The instructions are not English grammar but there are demo videos online.  The pinhole camera detector works as long as it's in a dark room.  No lasers just LEDs.  For looking for fields I think it works better than the Trifield which cost about 7 times as much and doesn't make any reaction noises.

Reviews.Title: Did not work for me :-(
Reviews.Author: yendor.
Reviews.Content: This device isn't what I excepted, It indicates in areas that don't have anything to do with a bug or ant type of monitoring equipment, However when I place it around a device that I know works it wont do anything!!!! The only thing that may work just a little is the red light and again this is with equipment that I have set up myself!

Reviews.Title: Hmmm...directions in a mystery language
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually used this device yet because the directions, although written using English language words, they aren't words that when put together actually make any sense.  So, in order to figure out how to use this thing, I'll just have to play around with it and figure it out myself.  I had read the comments before purchasing this item, but figured I'd be able to figure out how it worked even if the English wasn't written by someone who actually writes understandable English - ding ding...wrong.  So, not knowing how to use it/how it works, I can't really rate it a one-star, because once I figure it out it may actually work well...don't know that yet.  Someone else had commented that it beeps or lights up or whatever it does at anything and everything.  I'm still going to try figure it out just by trying different things.  But if you're not good with puzzles or solving problems or even wanting to risk chancing it or spending the money, I probably wouldn't get it unless I knew someone who actually owned one, knew how it worked and that it did do what it was supposed to, and could show me how.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: DADDY
Reviews.Content: Its good.....could be hard to tell what it is going on at times depending on location. But it dont tell you....hey theres god damn tracken device under your fender...make sure to sweep areas good....

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: The battery duration is too short. The battery durarion is too short for scanning. Isnt good for a long work.

Reviews.Title: It works, but without comprehensible instructions, who knows what it's actually finding.
Reviews.Author: MarchHare
Reviews.Content: It works but the instructions really need modification for the English-speaking market - preferably by someone fluent in English.  The other thing is that it tells you when it's detected a bug, but not specifically where, and unless you want to punch holes in walls looking, just verifying their existence isn't necessarily as desirable as deactivating or disabling them (or, best of all, removing them).  And even if the instructions were in a recognizable Western language, it's dubious whether such a device can actually deliver peace of mind.  I don't know what I was expecting - a debugger, maybe? - but I don't think this little device was even designed for that.  Still, if you have a clearer picture of what you can and can't expect from it, you probably won't be as disappointed as I was.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's supposed to.
Reviews.Author: drj
Reviews.Content: Will pinpoint almost any active radio source.  I use it to police devices in an area that are planted to spy - such as hidden wifi cameras, hidden wifi bugs, hidden Cellular devices etc.  Finds any active radio source and any active laser pointed in your vicinity.  Excellent price, too!  No problems using it first time out.

Reviews.Title: not worth even $20 that I paid for it.
Reviews.Author: REX J. WOOTEN
Reviews.Content: this really does seem more like a toy than an actual useable device.Really thought it was difficult to use.  Tested it on my cell phone's wifi and blue tooth.It found them but it had to be really close.  The more "sensitive" settings are difficult to set to a good balance.I had no idea if i was making it too sensitive or not.

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Daziegrl4
Reviews.Content: The detector does not work at all. However, the company was really cool and did not ask me to return the defective device. This is probably a company that has very high standards with how they treat their customers. I will keep them around and see what else they have to sell and hopefully we can do business with some other product in the future.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: UNDER DOG "GOTOGUY1979"
Reviews.Content: I like this product, I think it was well made and works well, as with some other this one also has some problems with the directions being vague and empty but none the less if you can figure it out its a good product

Reviews.Title: I think it is defective
Reviews.Author: Milton Wirthlin
Reviews.Content: As soon as it is turned on it emits the maximum response, no matter where it is.  I do not think it was properly tested before being issued and sold. I consider it a waste of my money.

Reviews.Title: instructions
Reviews.Author: Melissa McMaster
Reviews.Content: the instructions are printed way too small and are a little confusing. it did find several areas that seem to have bugs, but the actual bug was never found

Reviews.Title: Very good product.
Reviews.Author: Timothy Bryan
Reviews.Content: I use this detector a lot. It's almost disturbing how much it picks up. Very good for the price. I never knew this much RF was going through the air!I highly recommend this product in this day and age. You never know who's really out there.

Reviews.Title: not working
Reviews.Author: Yasser Khalifa
Reviews.Content: not realy working , it's  only notic the in ternet wairless not worth paying itits only look like a toy

Reviews.Title: I dont know
Reviews.Author: Robert J Brooks
Reviews.Content: I have not figured out how to use it yet. It goes off at any electrical outlet, the tv etc.

Reviews.Title: I Spy
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: This product it great to carry with you when you travel. You never know who is looking to video record some private act in a hotel or other function. Scan away and protect your privacy people. Spying is fun

Reviews.Title: What a joke
Reviews.Author: Shauna
Reviews.Content: This anti-spy signal bug is complicated to use but the instructions, originally written in Chinese and then loosely translated to English, are unintelligible.  This was a complete waste of my money and the first in a succession of three purchases from Amazon that have failed to work

Reviews.Title: Whimsical
Reviews.Author: martin
Reviews.Content: I wish I knew where I put this thing to play around with it while I write the review just for laughs. I didn't know why I bought this , really just a movie prop.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Love for Life
Reviews.Content: This product arrived faster than expected. The item was nicely packaged with accessories. The product is extremely light (in weight) and a better quality than I expected. This is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This product has no real instructions, has no real way of showing how the product can be used to detect RF waves and has no way telling you if there is really a camera being used.Piece of garbage/save your money.Buy you mother some flowers and do some real good.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: ej
Reviews.Content: I have not tried it out. but came on time and as appears to be ok I hope it works.

Adjust potentiometer adjustable sensitivity. (Greater sensitivity to widen the scope of or reduce the sensitivity to detect reduced Detection range) quickly identify the waves at source.
